So far this year I'm applying for conventions, see how that goes, if I actually make a profit or not. Apart from that... My shop doesn't tend to sell much so I close it every once in a while, otherwise I lose money (haven't gotten any new orders apart from the ones I got the day it reopened).

I honestly don't know if I can put up with the stress of trying to make it as an indie artist and have my income rely entirely on the reach I get on the Internet and the social media overlords being kind or evil. It's stressful enough as it is right now and I'm not even putting all my energy into it

It's not about giving up, I know I'll make art as long as I'm alive because that's what I live for. But I chose to try and pursue an art career because there really aren't many other things I can do day after day without losing my mind. The moment I find something else, I'll pursue that instead.

Like the one reason I wanted art to be my main job is because is one of the very few things I can do every day and not burn out immediately. Drawing is an activity I can keep up fairly well. Even if I draw for others. I can do it. I have no idea what else I could do reliably for more than 6 months.

Oh, I'm sure! I don't think it's a worse or lesser path, I honestly do think it would bring a better balance. Doing something other than art is beneficial to give your head a rest. It's just... Hard to find a job that doesn't drain all energy from me. And that'd defeat the purpose of a part time job
I can't believe I'm seriously considering being an independent artist online as a SAFER path than an industry WHAT IS THIS WORLD
(I'll prob delete this later, I'm just venting)

Ok so, with me still trying to become a decent artist, and with every industry firing people much more talented than me... What... What do I do.

Apart from stop kidding myself and find a part time job outside of art (which, with my mental health, is not precisely a straight forward task).
Thanks! It was my new year's resolution to do at least 10 minutes of figure drawing a day and the improvement has been very satisfying
